results.title: Just weeds
results.creator_credit: Sol Dworkin, Evelyn Spice and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Spread by water and wind, by birds and man’s carelessness, weeds cost the Canadian farmer over one hundred million dollars each year. Several varieties of common weeds are identified, with a warning against the danger from each. Control measures such as the use of clean seed, special crops, sheep grazing, cutting and spraying are illustrated and, throughout, proper cultivation is shown as the basic remedy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sol Dworkin, Evelyn Spice and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: No nukes
results.creator_credit: Anthony Potenza, Danny Goldberg, Julian Schlossberg and MUSE
results.brief_description: MUSE, (Musicians United for Safe Energy) is a group of musicians and activists working together to put an end to the threat of nuclear weapons and power plants. This video captures one of the many concerts performed by MUSE and takes place at Madison Square Garden in the US in 1980. The “No Nukes Concert” starred Jackson Browne, Crosby, Stills and Nash, The Doobie Brothers, John Hall, Graham Nash, Bonnie Raitt, Gil Scott-Heron, Carly Simon, Bruce Springsteen and The E Street Band, James Taylor and Jesse Colin Young and includes among the 20 songs performed “Mockingbird” (James Taylor and Carly Simon), “Running on empty” (Jackson Browne) “Thunder road” and “The River” (Bruce Springsteen and The E Street Band. The documentary footage was directed by Barbara Kopple and Haskell Wexler.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anthony Potenza, Danny Goldberg, Julian Schlossberg and MUSE

results.title: No more west
results.creator_credit: Nick Grinde, Educational Pictures and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Starring comedian Bert Lahr who played the cowardly lion in the Wizard of Oz with Judy Garland. A comic story set in the wild wild west featuring Bert Lahr as the sheriff who finds himself unwittingly facing court for robbing a bank when he was supposed to be out catching the actual bank robbers.

results.title: No more Hibakusha!
results.creator_credit: Audrey Schirmer, Martin Duckworth, Jacques Vallee and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Hibakusha is the Japanese word for the survivors of the American bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki. This powerful and moving documentary focuses on a few of the eighty hibakusha who journeyed from Japan to New York in June, 1982, to take part in peace demonstrations held to coincide with the Second United Nations Special Session on Disarmament. They came to urge the nations of the world to prevent nuclear war. Instead of concentrating on the physical suffering of the victims, the film reveals the mental anguish of the hibakusha, who are still haunted by nightmares. Inspired by “Hibakusha”, a book of photographs by Ittetsu Morishita. (Awards: Tokyo, Leipzig)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Audrey Schirmer, Martin Duckworth, Jacques Vallee and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Just one of the boys
results.creator_credit: Mike Mahoney, Ted Haley and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A profile of Eric Davidson, who has been totally blind since the age of two, a victim of the 1917 Halifax explosion. Despite his blindness, Mr. Davidson has spent the past twenty years as a full-time automotive mechanic for the city of Halifax. He is actively involved in the restoration and rebuilding of antique cars and is a well known member of the Antique Car Club.

results.title: Kaante
results.creator_credit: Sanjay Gupta, Pritish Nandy Communications and Raju Patel
results.brief_description: This Bollywood remake of “Reservoir dogs” (Tarantino, 1992) is a lot of fun to watch with its musical numbers and an inventive reworking of the central narrative about a gang of criminals who are infiltrated by an undercover cop. After pulling off a daring bank robbery, and lucky escape from the law, the band retreat to sniff out the nark among them. Featuring sprightly performances by Amitabh Bachchan, Sanjay Dutt, Suniel Shetty, Mahesh Manjrekar, Lucky Ali and Kumar Gaurav, the narrative also addresses ethnic stereotyping as the crew lament their treatment at the hands of the Los Angeles Police Department.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sanjay Gupta, Pritish Nandy Communications and Raju Patel

results.title: Ka-wayawayama: Aeroplane Dance
results.creator_credit: Christina Pozzan, Trevor Graham, Film Australia and Jan Wositzky
results.brief_description: Records the story of “Ka-wayawayama” or “Aeroplane Dance” of the Yanuwa people of the Borroloola area in the Northern Territory. The dance was created after an American “Liberator” bomber crashed in the area in 1942, after a mission in the South-west Pacific. Re-creates the plight of the flight crew in their trek across inhospitable terrain across the Gulf of Carpentaria and the search for the lost crew.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christina Pozzan, Trevor Graham, Film Australia and Jan Wositzky
